intro: Averrhoidium gardnerianum, commonly known as the Gardner's broom. It is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly found in Jamaica and Cuba. The plant belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Averrhoidium gardnerianum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
